ranked_diseases.explanation: Classic features include thick eyebrows, long eyelashes, depressed nasal bridge, thin upper lip, long philtrum, microcephaly, intellectual disability, feeding difficulties, and growth retardation. The facial dysmorphisms are highly characteristic.
X-linked form with similar features to CdLS1 including distinctive facial features, microcephaly, intellectual disability, and growth retardation, though typically milder presentation.
Another subtype with characteristic facial features, developmental delay, and growth retardation, caused by mutations in SMC3 gene.

Features overlap including thick eyebrows, long eyelashes, feeding difficulties, developmental delay, and corpus callosum abnormalities, though typically includes hypoplastic fifth digits not mentioned here.
Shares microcephaly, intellectual disability, corpus callosum abnormalities, and some facial features, though typically includes Hirschsprung disease and more specific facial gestalt.
Features include intellectual disability, microcephaly, and distinctive facial features, though typically includes broad thumbs/toes not mentioned in this case.
Can present with microcephaly, feeding difficulties, developmental delay, and some overlapping facial features, though typically includes 2-3 toe syndactyly and cholesterol abnormalities.
